intro: Alopecurus bornmuelleri, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its fine, hair-like leaves and small, greenish flowers. This perennial herb typically grows in moist, meadow-like habitats and is often found in nutrient-rich soils. Its compact growth habit and delicate appearance make it a distinctive species within its ecological niche. Alopecurus bornmuelleri is also notable for its historical use in traditional herbal medicine.
